greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of f(q^3) * f(-q^8) * chi(-q^12) / chi(q) in powers of q where f(), chi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of eta(q) * eta(q^4) * eta(q^6)^3 * eta(q^8) / (eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^3) * eta(q^24)) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (48 t)) = 96^(1/2) (t/i) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A129402.
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, Boole[n == 0], (-1)^n DivisorSum[ n, KroneckerSymbol[ -6, #] &]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Nov 11 2015 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ q, -q] QPochhammer[ -q^3] QPochhammer[ q^8] QPochhammer[ q^12, -q^12], {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Nov 11 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, n==0, (-1)^n * sumdiv( n, d, kronecker( -6, d)))};
(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A) * eta(x^4 + A) * eta(x^6 + A)^3 * eta(x^8 + A) / (eta(x^2 + A)^2 * eta(x^3 + A) * eta(x^24 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, May 14 2011
